content.description: Overhung and balancy for the first half. Hidden pockets to pull the roof. Finish on fun finger crack. There is a bolt next to the crack, but it also protects nicely with gear. Bound to be an area classic; this is an excellent route.
content.location: Right of Black Bear, left of 11 O'clock.

content.description: Really fun warm-up despite the significantly chossy start. Lieback and sidepull straight up the crack feature, using positive stemming.
content.location: Right of 11 O'clock, left of The Bicycle Thief.

content.description: Tallest route before the trail turns around the corner. Slightly overhanging with a difficult finish on tenuous feet.
content.location: Right of Hungry Eyes, 25 yards left of Orbit.

content.description: Steep! bouldery start to steep overhang, tricky getting over the ledge and then 5.5 to anchors.
content.protection: 6 Bolts to fixed anchors. stick clip first bolt. 2 fixed draws at crux.
content.location: just right of "Head on a Silver Platypus" left of "4 Alarm Fire"

content.description: Easier if you use the crack beginning left of the 3rd bolt, better if you follow the bolt line.
content.location: 25 yards right of Orbit, just left of Disappearing Hat Trick.

content.description: Brilliant route. Start on somewhat powerful pinches, then move into a thin, technical layer. Pull through the short choss layer and finish on fantastic steep blocks. Big moves on positive holds.
content.location: 25 yards right of Stingray, 25 yards left of Rock-in My Sports Bra.

content.description:
Start on first bolt of Black Bear. Pull over small roof on big holds. Scramble up easy 4th class ramp to start of inside corner crack. Don't fall before you place that first piece!

Muchachos y muchachas, the crux of the climb is protected by a bolt. If you fall off the ramp before you get a piece in, you probably shouldn't have been attempting to climb the crack. In other words, it's safe, my babies! PG!
content.location: Right of Disappearing Hat Trick, left of Black Bear.

content.description: Steep, technical, and hard. Pinches, side pulls, and gastons are the name of the game here. Crux is mid-route.
content.location: Right of Hoppe Hill, left of Goat Meal.

content.description: Excellent route that is wonderfully sustained at the grade. Vertical climbing on positive edges the whole way up.
content.location: Right of Goat Meal, left of Stingray.

content.description: A bit tricky, this one. A little overhanging, big moves and smart feet will get you through the crux. Difficult fourth clip.
content.location: Right of 4-Alarm Fire, left of Hustle and Flow.

content.description: Start on chossy layer and work over the substantial roof on positive edges. Avoid going left, but trend right on good pinches. The holds thin out but remain positive for a fun, cruising finish.
content.location: About 50 yards to the right of Black Betty, Platypus is the first route among the concentration of new routes. Look for the obvious roof near the start.

content.description: Somewhat overhanging, the crux is firing the big moves over the roof while trying not to blow the delicate feet.
content.location: Right of Hustle and Flow, left of Hungry Eyes.

content.description: Follow the bolt-line along awkward but positive left-leaning rail.
content.location: Right of Rock-in My Sports Bra, left of 5.8 Crack.

content.description: Short, steep, and powerful. Some cryptic and tenuous movement at the crux from bolts 3 to 5. Eases toward the end. Fun hard route.
content.location: Accessed from the trail directly across the parking lot, Black Betty is the first route just past the large juniper.

content.description: Start on steep blocks, using big moves on big holds. Crux is on the thin, balancy headwall. Pumpy and technical. Best rock quality at Pointless.
content.location: Shares first bolt with 5.8 Crack. Left of What's the Point?

content.description: Start on the sculpted features at the bottom and take care negotiating to the second clip. Some of rock is still suspect in this layer. Big reaches will get you to positive sidepulls. Finish on difficult-to-find pockets on the column.
content.location: Right of Team Trailer, left of Alien Pod.

content.description: Short and sweet. Interesting feature with great sidepulls. Big holds the whole way. Gets steeper as you go up.

Slightly overhanging, traverse below the roof at the start to access first bolt. Use caution as a fall here would be unfortunate. Pull straight up for a few moves to a right-leaning rail. Look for pockets on the face and climb a few more bolts.
content.location: Right of Platypus, left of Hoppe Hill.

content.description: A little balance will help with this one. Some deceptive moves in the latter half. Follow the bolt line pretty much straight up.
content.location: Right of What's the Point?, left of Team Trailer.
